pkgmetadata.longdescription: Extreme Risk Measures // A set of procedures for estimating risks related to extreme events via risk measures such as expectile, value-at-risk, etc. is provided. Estimation methods for univariate independent observations and temporal dependent observations are available. The statistical inference is performed through parametric and non-parametric estimators. Inferential procedures such as confidence intervals and hypothesis testing are obtained by exploiting the asymptotic theory. Adapts the methodologies derived in Padoan and Stupfler (2020) arxiv:2004.04078, Daouia et al. (2018) doi:10.1111/rssb.12254, Drees (2000) doi:10.1214/aoap/1019487617, Drees (2003) doi:10.3150/bj/1066223272, de Haan and Ferreira (2006) doi:10.1007/0-387-34471-3, de Haan et al. (2016) doi:10.1007/s00780-015-0287-6.
